info.title: OpenAI GPT
info.description: OpenAI is an artificial intelligence research laboratory. The company conducts research in the field of AI with the stated goal of promoting and developing friendly AI in a way that benefits humanity as a whole. Through this connector you can access the Generative Pre-trained Transformer 4 (GPT-4), an autoregressive language model that uses deep learning to produce human-like text, plus many other models.

post.description: Creates a completion for the provided prompt and parameters.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The body.

model.description: ID of the model to use.
model.title: Model

prompt.description: The prompt(s) to generate completions for, encoded as a string, array of strings, array of tokens, or array of token arrays.
prompt.title: Prompt

max_tokens.description: The maximum number of tokens to generate in the completion.
max_tokens.title: Max Tokens

temperature.description: What sampling temperature to use, between 0 and 2. Higher values like 0.8 will make the output more random, while lower values like 0.2 will make it more focused and deterministic.
temperature.title: Temperature

top_p.description: An alternative to sampling with temperature, called nucleus sampling, where the model considers the results of the tokens with top_p probability mass. So 0.1 means only the tokens comprising the top 10% probability mass are considered.
top_p.title: Top P

n.description: How many completions to generate for each prompt.
n.title: N

logprobs.description: Include the log probabilities on the logprobs most likely tokens, as well the chosen tokens.
logprobs.title: Log Probabilities

stop.description: A sequence where the service will stop generating further tokens.
stop.title: Stop

post.description: Retrieves a chat completion powered by ChatGPT.

max_tokens.description: The maximum number of tokens to generate in the completion.
max_tokens.title: Max Tokens

temperature.description: What sampling temperature to use, between 0 and 2. Higher values like 0.8 will make the output more random, while lower values like 0.2 will make it more focused and deterministic.
temperature.title: Temperature

top_p.description: An alternative to sampling with temperature, called nucleus sampling, where the model considers the results of the tokens with top_p probability mass. So 0.1 means only the tokens comprising the top 10% probability mass are considered.
top_p.title: Top P

n.description: How many completions to generate for each prompt.
n.title: N

stop.description: A sequence where the service will stop generating further tokens.
stop.title: Stop

presence_penalty.description: Number between -2.0 and 2.0. Positive values penalize new tokens based on whether they appear in the text so far, increasing the model's likelihood to talk about new topics.
presence_penalty.title: Presence Penalty

frequency_penalty.description: Number between -2.0 and 2.0. Positive values penalize new tokens based on their existing frequency in the text so far, decreasing the model's likelihood to repeat the same line verbatim.
frequency_penalty.title: Frequency Penalty

user.description: A unique identifier representing your end-user, which can help OpenAI to monitor and detect abuse.
user.title: User

post.description: Creates a new edit for the provided input, instruction, and parameters.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The body.

model.title: Model
model.description: ID of the model to use.

input.description: The input text to use as a starting point for the edit.
input.title: Input

instruction.description: The instruction that tells the model how to edit the prompt.
instruction.title: Instruction

n.description: How many edits to generate for the input and instruction.
n.title: N

temperature.description: What sampling temperature to use, between 0 and 2. Higher values like 0.8 will make the output more random, while lower values like 0.2 will make it more focused and deterministic.
temperature.title: Temperature

top_p.description: An alternative to sampling with temperature, called nucleus sampling, where the model considers the results of the tokens with top_p probability mass. So 0.1 means only the tokens comprising the top 10% probability mass are considered.
top_p.title: Top P

get.description: Lists the currently available models, and provides basic information about each one such as the owner and availability.

post.description: Creates a job that fine-tunes a specified model from a given dataset.

training_file.description: The ID of an uploaded file that contains training data.
training_file.title: Training File

validation_file.description: The ID of an uploaded file that contains validation data.
validation_file.title: Validation File

model.description: The name of the model to fine-tune.
model.title: Model

n_epochs.description: The number of epochs to train the model for. An epoch refers to one full cycle through the training dataset.
n_epochs.title: Epochs

suffix.description: A string of up to 40 characters that will be added to your fine-tuned model name.
suffix.title: Suffix

get.description: Retrieve info about a fine-tuning job.

parameters.name: fine_tuning_job_id
parameters.description: The fine-tuning job identifier.

parameters.description: The fine-tuning job identifier.

parameters.name: fine_tuning_job_id
parameters.description: The fine-tuning job identifier.

parameters.name: after
parameters.description: The identifier for the last event from the previous pagination request.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of events to retrieve.

get.description: Retrieve status updates for a fine-tuning job.

self-harm/intent.description: The number of intent to self-harm.
self-harm/intent.title: self-harm/intent

post.description: Creates an image given a prompt.
Creates an edited or extended image given an original image and a prompt.

parameters.name: image
parameters.description: The image to edit.

parameters.name: prompt
parameters.description: A text description of the desired image.

parameters.name: mask
parameters.description: An additional image whose fully transparent areas (e.g. where alpha is zero) indicate where image should be edited.

parameters.name: model
parameters.description: The model to use for image generation.

parameters.description: The number of images to generate

parameters.name: size
